question: Question_02_(b)
statement:
Full-Solution Problems. Justify your answers and show all your work.
Simplification of answers is not required.

Express the \emph{y}-coordinate of the centroid (centre of mass) of the
region in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH101/April_2006/Question_02_(a)}{part
(a)} as a definite integral. Do not evaluate this integral.
sols:
Plugging in all the values gives

\begin{align*}
\bar{y}&=\frac{3}{7}\int_{-1}^{1}\frac{1}{2}\left((2-x^2)^2-(|x|)^{2}\right)dx\\
&=\frac{3}{14}\int_{-1}^{1} \left(4-4x^2+x^4-x^2\right)dx\\
&=\frac{3}{14}\int_{-1}^{1}(4-5x^2+x^4)dx
\end{align*}

completing the question.
hints:
The \emph{y} coordinate of the centroid is computed using the formula

\[\bar{y}=\frac{1}{A}\int_{a}^{b}\frac{1}{2}(f(x)^2-g(x)^{2})dx\]

where \emph{A} is the area.
